citations.narrative:
The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care for vaccinations. Of the 58 adult dogs, 9 are not up to date on all
three of the required vaccinations (distemper, parvovirus, and rabies). The current Program of Vet Care prescribes for the
vaccinations to be performed yearly.
- Adult male Poodle #4095 is overdue for the distemper/parvovirus (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-23
and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current.
- Adult male Poodle #5435 is overdue for the distemper/parvovirus (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-23
and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current.
- Adult female Poodle #7494 is overdue for the rabies vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-5-23 and was due on 2-5-24.
The distemper/parvovirus (“7 way”) vaccine is current.
- Adult female Cavapoo #7544 is overdue for the distemper/parvovirus (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-
23 and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current.
- Adult female Cavapoo #7553 is overdue for the distemper/parvovirus (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-
23 and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current.
- Adult male Cavalier King Charles Spaniel #4094 is overdue for the distemper/parvovirus (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine
was last given 2-1-23 and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current.
- Adult male Maltese #2719 is overdue for the distemper/parvovirus (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-23
and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current.
- Adult female Bichon-Poodle cross #3566 is overdue for the distemper/parvovirus (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was
last given 1-3-23 and was due 1-3-24. The rabies vaccine is current.
- Adult male Poodle #8953 is overdue for the distemper/parvovirus (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-23
and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current.
Distemper, parvovirus, and rabies are life-threatening diseases and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering.
It is also important for breeding females to be vaccinated as they will pass immunity to their offspring through their milk.
Correct by vaccinating for distemper, parvovirus, and rabies in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending
Veterinarian and vaccine manufacturer recommendations.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 13, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care for vaccinations. Of the 58 adult dogs, 9 are not up to date on all 
three of the required vaccinations (distemper, parvovirus,  and rabies). The current Program of Vet Care prescribes for the 
vaccinations to be performed  yearly. 
 
- Adult male Poodle #4095 is overdue  for the distemper/parvovirus  (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-23 
and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current. 
- Adult male Poodle #5435 is overdue  for the distemper/parvovirus  (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-23 
and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current. 
- Adult female Poodle #7494 is overdue  for the rabies vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-5-23 and was due on 2-5-24. 
The distemper/parvovirus  (“7 way”) vaccine is current. 
- Adult female Cavapoo  #7544 is overdue  for the distemper/parvovirus  (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-
23 and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current. 
- Adult female Cavapoo  #7553 is overdue  for the distemper/parvovirus  (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-
23 and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current. 
- Adult male Cavalier  King Charles Spaniel #4094 is overdue  for the distemper/parvovirus  (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine 
was last given 2-1-23 and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current.  
- Adult male Maltese #2719 is overdue  for the distemper/parvovirus  (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-23 
and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current. 
- Adult female Bichon-Poodle cross #3566 is overdue  for the distemper/parvovirus  (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was 
last given 1-3-23 and was due 1-3-24. The rabies vaccine is current. 
- Adult male Poodle #8953 is overdue  for the distemper/parvovirus  (“7 way”) vaccine. This vaccine was last given 2-1-23 
and was due 2-1-24. The rabies vaccine is current. 
 
 
Distemper, parvovirus,  and rabies are life-threatening  diseases and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering. 
It is also important for breeding females to be vaccinated as they will pass immunity to their offspring through their milk. 
Correct by vaccinating for distemper, parvovirus,  and rabies in accordance with a schedule approved  by the Attending 
Veterinarian and vaccine manufacturer recommendations.

This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 13, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
